intro: Paepalanthus pungens var. brevifolius, commonly known as the short-leaved pungent plant, is a species native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Bromeliaceae family, known for its striking, colorful inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that form a rosette, and it produces small, showy flowers in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
